meanings.definition: The part of the alimentary canal below the stomach; the intestine.
meanings.sent1: After eating, food travels through the bowel to be digested.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the patient's bowel to check for any issues.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly added too much spice, turning the dish into a fiery bowel of discomfort.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up from deep within her like a playful bowel of joy.
meanings.sent5: The winding path of the bowel resembled a mysterious underground tunnel.

meanings.definition: The interior parts of anything; the inner part; the inside.
meanings.sent1: He explored the dark bowel of the cave, searching for hidden treasures.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the car's engine, focusing on the intricate bowel of wires.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, surprising everyone with its hidden bowel.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting revealed the emotional bowel of the human soul.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map led them to the hidden bowel of the forgotten temple.
